newsitem.title: USA: API says U.S. crude stocks fell in week.
newsitem.headline: API says U.S. crude stocks fell in week.

text.p: U.S. crude oil stocks held in primary storage fell 831,000 barrels in the week ended Sept 20 to 306.91 million barrels from 307.74 million in the prior week, the American Petroleum Institute (API) said Tuesday.
API said that crude stocks excluding PADD 5 (Petroleum Administration for Defense District) fell 2.53 million barrels in the week to 235.03 million barrels.
Distillate stocks rose 303,000 barrels to 112.36 million from 112.06 million. However, PADD 1 distillate stocks fell 25,000 barrels to 38.45 million barrels.
API said crude runs to processing units rose to 14.52 million barrels from 14.49 million barrels. Percent of capacity rose to 95.5 percent in the week from 95.0 percent.
Residual fuel stocks in the latest week rose to 35.77 million barrels from 34.78 million in the previous week, and crude oil imports fell to 7.30 million barrels per day from 7.57 million, API said.
